questions.question: Who is the Father of the Indian Constitution?
questions.explanation: B. R. Ambedkar is known as the Father of the Indian Constitution

questions.question: Which Indian state has the longest coastline?
questions.explanation: Gujarat has the longest coastline among Indian states

questions.question: Which of these is the largest river in India by volume?
questions.explanation: Brahmaputra carries the largest volume of water among Indian rivers

questions.question: The 'Quit India' movement was launched in which year?
questions.explanation: Quit India Movement was launched in 1942

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO)?
questions.explanation: ISRO is responsible for space exploration and satellite technology

questions.question: In which city is the famous Victoria Memorial located?
questions.explanation: Victoria Memorial is located in Kolkata

questions.question: The 'Golden Temple' of Amritsar is the most sacred site for which religion?
questions.explanation: Golden Temple is the holiest shrine in Sikhism

questions.question: Which mountain range is the source of the Ganges and Yamuna rivers?
questions.explanation: Both Ganges and Yamuna originate from the Himalayas

questions.question: Which Indian city is known as the 'Silicon Valley of India'?
questions.explanation: Bengaluru is known as the Silicon Valley of India

questions.question: What is the scientific name of the national tree of India, the Banyan?
questions.explanation: Ficus benghalensis is the scientific name for Banyan tree

questions.question: The first Indian to win the Nobel Prize was...
questions.explanation: Rabindranath Tagore was the first Indian Nobel laureate in 1913

questions.question: Which of the following is a classical dance form from North India?
questions.explanation: Kathak originated in North India

questions.question: The famous 'Sunderbans' forest is known for which animal?
questions.explanation: Sunderbans is famous for Royal Bengal Tigers

questions.question: The 'Father of Indian Cinema' is a title given to which person?
questions.explanation: Dadasaheb Phalke is known as the Father of Indian Cinema

questions.question: What is the main source of vitamin D?
questions.explanation: Sunlight is the primary source of Vitamin D

questions.question: Which monument was built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to Mumbai?
questions.explanation: Gateway of India was built to commemorate the royal visit

questions.question: The 'Rani ki Vav' stepwell, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is located in which state?
questions.explanation: Rani ki Vav is located in Patan, Gujarat

questions.question: Which vitamin is crucial for blood clotting?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is essential for blood clotting

questions.question: The currency of India is the Rupee. What is its symbol?
questions.explanation: ‚Çπ is the symbol for Indian Rupee

questions.question: Who was the first woman Prime Minister of India?
questions.explanation: Indira Gandhi was the first woman Prime Minister of India

questions.question: The first successful nuclear test in India was conducted in which state?
questions.explanation: First nuclear test was conducted in Pokhran, Rajasthan

questions.question: What is the full form of 'BSE' in the context of the Indian stock market?
questions.explanation: BSE stands for Bombay Stock Exchange

questions.question: The national anthem of India, 'Jana Gana Mana', was originally composed in which language?
questions.explanation: Jana Gana Mana was originally written in Bengali by Rabindranath Tagore

questions.question: Which of these Indian cities is situated on the banks of the River Yamuna?
questions.explanation: Agra is situated on the banks of Yamuna river

questions.question: The term 'Zero Hour' in the Indian Parliament refers to...
options: The first hour of the session
The last hour of the session
The period immediately following the Question Hour
The time before the session begins
questions.explanation: Zero Hour is the period immediately following Question Hour

questions.question: The 'Fundamental Duties' were added to the Indian Constitution on the recommendation of which committee?
questions.explanation: Swaran Singh Committee recommended adding Fundamental Duties

questions.question: Which Indian state is the largest producer of rice?
questions.explanation: West Bengal is the largest producer of rice in India

questions.question: The 'Ajanta Caves' are primarily associated with the art of which religion?
questions.explanation: Ajanta Caves feature Buddhist rock-cut monuments

questions.question: Who authored the famous book 'Discovery of India'?
questions.explanation: Jawaharlal Nehru wrote 'Discovery of India'

questions.question: Which day is celebrated as 'National Science Day' in India?
questions.explanation: National Science Day is celebrated on February 28th to mark Raman Effect discovery

questions.question: What is the primary function of CSS?
questions.explanation: CSS is used for styling and layout of web pages

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a programming language?
questions.explanation: HTML is a markup language, not a programming language

questions.question: What is a 'variable' in programming?
options: A container for storing data values
questions.explanation: A variable is a named storage location for data

questions.question: Which data structure operates on a Last-In, First-Out (LIFO) principle?
questions.explanation: Stack follows LIFO (Last-In, First-Out) principle

questions.question: What does 'API' stand for?
questions.explanation: API stands for Application Programming Interface

questions.question: Which of these is used for version control in software development?
questions.explanation: Git is a popular version control system

questions.question: What is a 'bug' in programming?
options: A physical insect in the computer
An error or defect in a program
questions.explanation: A bug is an error or flaw in a computer program

questions.question: Which term refers to the process of finding and fixing errors in code?
questions.explanation: Debugging is the process of finding and fixing errors

questions.question: What is the purpose of a 'for' loop?
options: To execute a block of code a specific number of times
questions.explanation: For loop repeats a block of code a specific number of times

questions.question: Which symbol is used for a single-line comment in Python?
questions.explanation: # is used for single-line comments in Python

questions.question: What is a 'Boolean' data type?
options: A value that can be true or false
questions.explanation: Boolean represents true or false values

questions.question: Which term describes a reusable block of code designed to perform a specific task?
questions.explanation: A function is a reusable block of code

questions.question: In JavaScript, what keyword is used to declare a variable that cannot be reassigned?
questions.explanation: const is used for constants that cannot be reassigned

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a database?
options: To store, manage, and retrieve data
questions.explanation: Databases are used to store and manage data

questions.question: Which of these is an example of an algorithm?
options: A set of step-by-step instructions to solve a problem
questions.explanation: An algorithm is a step-by-step procedure to solve a problem

questions.question: What does 'HTTP' stand for?
questions.explanation: HTTP stands for Hyper Text Transfer Protocol

questions.question: Which language is primarily used for creating Android mobile apps?
questions.explanation: Kotlin and Java are primary languages for Android development

questions.question: What is a 'compiler'?
options: A program that translates source code into machine code
questions.explanation: A compiler translates high-level code to machine code

questions.question: Which of the following is a key concept of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)?
questions.explanation: Inheritance is a key OOP concept

questions.question: What does a 'front-end' developer primarily work on?
options: The user-facing part of a website
questions.explanation: Front-end developers work on client-side/user interface

questions.question: What is the purpose of an 'if-else' statement?
options: To make a decision based on a condition
questions.explanation: if-else statements make decisions based on conditions

questions.question: In programming, what is an 'array'?
options: A collection of items of the same data type
questions.explanation: An array is a collection of similar data items

questions.question: Which language is known as the 'mother of all languages'?
questions.explanation: C is often called the mother of modern programming languages

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using a 'class' in programming?
options: It allows for code reusability and organization
questions.explanation: Classes enable code reusability through inheritance and organization

questions.question: What is an 'interpreter'?
options: A program that translates and executes code line by line
A physical part of a computer
questions.explanation: An interpreter executes code directly line by line

questions.question: Which of these is a common framework for building websites with Python?
questions.explanation: Django is a popular Python web framework

questions.question: What does SQL stand for?
questions.explanation: SQL stands for Structured Query Language

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a back-end programming language?
questions.explanation: CSS is a styling language, not a back-end programming language

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of a 'recursive' function?
options: It does not return a value
questions.explanation: A recursive function calls itself to solve smaller instances of the same problem

questions.question: Which term refers to the process of protecting information by transforming it into an unreadable format?
questions.explanation: Encryption converts data into unreadable format for security

questions.question: What is the primary function of Machine Learning (ML)?
options: To perform complex mathematical calculations only
To enable systems to learn from data without being explicitly programmed
questions.explanation: ML enables systems to learn and improve from experience without explicit programming

questions.question: Which term describes a machine that can only perform one specific, narrow task?
questions.explanation: ANI is designed for specific tasks like playing chess or image recognition

questions.question: If you train a model using a dataset where the answers are already provided, what type of learning is this?
questions.explanation: Supervised learning uses labeled datasets to train models

questions.question: What does the acronym NLP stand for in AI?
questions.explanation: NLP stands for Natural Language Processing

questions.question: Which is the main programming language widely adopted for AI and ML?
questions.explanation: Python is the most popular language for AI/ML due to its extensive libraries

questions.question: What is an 'Artificial Neural Network' designed to mimic?
questions.explanation: Neural networks are inspired by the structure and function of the human brain

questions.question: Which framework is a popular open-source library for deep learning developed by Google?
questions.explanation: TensorFlow was developed by Google for deep learning applications

questions.question: Which sub-field of AI focuses on enabling machines to 'see' and interpret visual data?
questions.explanation: Computer Vision enables machines to interpret and understand visual information

questions.question: What is 'Clustering' primarily used for?
options: Rewarding an agent for correct actions
questions.explanation: Clustering groups similar data points without predefined labels

questions.question: What is the primary concern with 'Bias' in AI?
options: The model cannot be integrated with other systems
It leads to unfair or prejudiced outcomes for certain groups
It requires too much data for training
questions.explanation: AI bias can lead to unfair treatment of certain demographic groups

questions.question: Which type of learning involves an agent interacting with an environment to maximize cumulative reward?
questions.explanation: Reinforcement learning involves agents learning through trial and error with rewards

questions.question: In a neural network, what is the role of an 'Activation Function'?
options: To calculate the final error rate
To convert data into numerical format
To introduce non-linearity into the model, allowing it to learn complex patterns
To define the number of input features
questions.explanation: Activation functions introduce non-linearity, enabling neural networks to learn complex patterns

questions.question: What is 'overfitting'?
options: The model is too simple to capture the data trend
The model performs well on training data but poorly on unseen data
The model is trained with too few features
The process of reducing the number of variables in a dataset
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model learns training data too well but fails to generalize to new data

questions.question: Which algorithm is used for dimensionality reduction to simplify models and reduce computation time?
questions.explanation: PCA is a popular technique for dimensionality reduction

questions.question: What is the core idea behind 'Generative AI'?
options: Creating new, realistic content (like images, text, or music)
Improving the security of data encryption
questions.explanation: Generative AI creates new content rather than just analyzing existing data

questions.question: Which component of an Artificial Neural Network takes the input and calculates a weighted sum?
questions.explanation: Neurons in hidden layers calculate weighted sums of inputs

questions.question: What is the name of the iterative process used to adjust the weights of a neural network based on the error?
questions.explanation: Backpropagation adjusts weights based on error gradients

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for recommendation systems by finding similarities between users or items?
questions.explanation: KNN is often used in recommendation systems for finding similar users/items

questions.question: What does 'tokenization' mean in the context of Natural Language Processing (NLP)?
options: Breaking down text into smaller units like words or sub-words
Generating new sentences based on input
questions.explanation: Tokenization splits text into smaller units (tokens) for processing

questions.question: What is the key advantage of a 'Convolutional Layer' in a CNN for image processing?
options: It reduces the dimensionality of the image immediately
It automatically learns and extracts spatial hierarchies of features (edges, textures, etc.)
It always runs faster than any other layer
questions.explanation: Convolutional layers automatically learn hierarchical features from images

questions.question: The process of using a pre-trained model on a new, related task is called:
questions.explanation: Transfer learning leverages pre-trained models for new tasks

questions.question: Which metric is generally used to evaluate a regression model's performance?
questions.explanation: MAE and similar metrics are used for regression model evaluation

questions.question: What is the goal of an 'Intelligent Agent' in AI?
options: To perform only one pre-programmed task repeatedly
To perceive its environment and take actions that maximize its chance of success
To store and retrieve large amounts of data
questions.explanation: Intelligent agents perceive environments and act to achieve goals

questions.question: What does 'Data Augmentation' involve, especially in Computer Vision?
options: Removing bad data points from the dataset
Converting images to black and white only
Creating new, modified samples from existing training data (e.g., rotating or flipping images) to expand the dataset
The final step of model deployment
questions.explanation: Data augmentation creates variations of training data to improve model generalization

questions.question: A 'Heuristic' in AI search algorithms is best described as:
options: A fixed, predetermined path to the goal
A simple, non-optimal 'rule of thumb' or estimate that guides the search towards a solution
The total time required to find the solution
A mathematical formula for calculating weights
questions.explanation: Heuristics are rules of thumb that help guide search algorithms more efficiently

questions.question: Which term refers to the parameter that controls the step size when adjusting the weights of a neural network during training?
questions.explanation: Learning rate controls how much to change the model in response to estimated error

questions.question: What is the primary function of a 'Loss Function' in training a model?
options: To randomly select features for the model
To measure how well the model is performing compared to the expected output
questions.explanation: Loss function quantifies how well the model's predictions match the actual values

questions.question: Which method is commonly used to prevent overfitting by randomly setting a fraction of neurons to zero during training?
questions.explanation: Dropout randomly ignores neurons during training to prevent overfitting

questions.question: In Supervised Learning, which task involves predicting a categorical label?
questions.explanation: Classification predicts categorical labels, regression predicts continuous values

questions.question: What is the primary function of a Recurrent Neural Network (RNN)?
options: To recognize objects in static images
To process sequences of data, such as text or time series, where order matters
questions.explanation: RNNs are designed for sequential data where order and context matter

questions.question: What is the sum of all angles in a quadrilateral?
questions.explanation: The sum of all angles in a quadrilateral is always 360 degrees

questions.question: What is the formula for the area of a rectangle?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = length √ó width

questions.explanation: 2 is the smallest and only even prime number

The ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter

questions.explanation: Pythagoras theorem: a¬≤ + b¬≤ = c¬≤ where c is the hypotenuse

questions.explanation: A tangent touches a circle at exactly one point

questions.explanation: Median connects a vertex to the midpoint of the opposite side

questions.explanation: Rational numbers can be expressed as fractions p/q

questions.explanation: Sum of cubes = [n(n+1)/2]¬≤

questions.question: In algebra, what is a 'monomial'?

questions.explanation: HCF of two distinct prime numbers is always 1

questions.question: A polygon with 8 sides is called a...?
questions.explanation: Octagon has 8 sides

questions.question: What is the definition of a 'prime number'?
options: A number with exactly two factors: 1 and itself
A number that can only be divided by 1
A number that is not divisible by 2
questions.explanation: Prime numbers have exactly two distinct factors: 1 and themselves

questions.explanation: Product of two consecutive integers is always even (divisible by 2)

questions.explanation: Associative property: grouping doesn't affect the result

questions.explanation: Mode is the value that appears most frequently

questions.explanation: Circumference is the perimeter of a circle

questions.question: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria is known as the powerhouse of the cell

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?

questions.question: What is the study of the universe and celestial objects called?

questions.explanation: Copper is an excellent conductor of electricity

questions.explanation: Freezing is the phase change from liquid to solid

questions.explanation: Botany is the study of plants

questions.question: Which of the following is a renewable source of energy?

questions.explanation: Nuclear fission splits large atomic nuclei into smaller ones

questions.explanation: Pancreas produces insulin to regulate blood sugar

questions.explanation: Troposphere is the lowest layer of Earth's atmosphere

questions.explanation: Sodium chloride is commonly known as table salt

questions.question: Which of these is a vertebrate?
questions.explanation: Frogs are vertebrates (have backbone)

questions.question: What is the SI unit for temperature?
questions.explanation: Kelvin is the SI base unit for temperature

questions.explanation: Gravity pulls objects toward Earth's center

questions.question: The 'Harshacharita' was written by which court poet of King Harsha?

questions.question: The famous poet Tulsidas, who wrote the Ramcharitmanas, lived during the reign of which Mughal Emperor?

questions.question: Which is the largest ocean on Earth?

questions.question: Which of these is the largest continent by land area?

questions.explanation: Tokyo is the capital of Japan

questions.question: The 'Sahara Desert' is located on which continent?

questions.question: Which river is the longest in the world?
questions.explanation: Nile River is traditionally considered the longest river

questions.question: What is the name of the largest island in the world?

questions.question: Mount Everest, the world's highest peak, is located in which mountain range?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is in the Himalayas

questions.question: Which country is also known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun'?

questions.question: The 'Great Barrier Reef' is located off the coast of which country?
